definition: surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
to recall (a product, an ambassador etc)
to have the power to rally supporters
to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
Nanzhao county in Nanyang 南陽|南阳[Nan2 yang2], Henan
Nanzhao county in Nanyang 南陽|南阳[Nan2 yang2], Henan

sentences.english: God's people would go to war whenever he called on them.
sentences.chinese: 只要神一呼召，神的子民便會披甲上陣。

sentences.english: Then Moses summoned Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab.
sentences.chinese: 摩西打發人去召以利押的兒子大坍，亞比蘭。

sentences.english: We were recalled by a scream.
sentences.chinese: 我們被一聲尖叫召回來了。

sentences.english: The Emperor immediately sprang out of bed, and caused his body physician to be called;
sentences.chinese: 皇帝立即跳下牀，命令把他的御醫召進來。

sentences.english: General Bradley wouldn't send for you unless he had something in mind.
sentences.chinese: 除非他心裏有數，否則布拉德利將軍不會召您來的。

sentences.english: For many are called, but few are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 因爲被召的人多，但被選上的人少。

sentences.english: But when God, who set me apart from birth and called me by his grace, was pleased.
sentences.chinese: 然而那把我從母腹裏分別出來，又施恩召我的神。

sentences.english: Once the call set up prostitution charges, he could be sentenced to 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 一旦召雛妓指控成立，他可能將被判15年。

sentences.english: I do not see it going to the convention.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲競選會持續到全國大會召開時。

sentences.english: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace.
sentences.chinese: 然而那把我從母腹裏分別出來，又施恩召我的神。

sentences.english: I was also 14, when Emperor Taizong called for me. How did you enter the palace?
sentences.chinese: 太宗皇帝召我進宮時，我也十四歲。你是怎麼進的宮？

sentences.english: Please whistle up all the dogs quickly.
Please bleep the doctor on duty immediately.
sentences.chinese: 請立刻用傳呼機召值班醫生。

sentences.english: In a moment, we'll see the Meidai Monastery.
sentences.chinese: 一會兒我們去美岱召看看。

sentences.english: For many are invited, but few are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 因爲被召的人多，選上的人少。

sentences.english: Zhaowentai is the city's landmark structure. The name Wendeng comes from it.
sentences.chinese: 召文臺是文登的標誌性建築，文登之名也就來源於此。

definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
